1520051262_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
It is always a good time to read Ishmael, My Ishmael and the Story of B by Daniel Quinn.

The books don't offer up any 'answers' but they sure make some very profound points about humans and the way humans live today.

1523661437_19YSf1pQqhyzuSp49GF3tnw51WmXN.body:
After reading Ishmael by Daniel Quinn I stopped thinking about things like this. Every culture, group etc has a story they tell themselves to live by. 

My Ishmael and The Story of B were good as well.

1525258130_18NrbxMytZcJcDcsUadLeSAfZ2f49.body:
The Zeitgeist Movement had some ties with The Venus Project but they split apart some time ago. I'd say Zeitgeist would be more controversial today then The Venus Project. The simple reason for that is TZM challenges the status quo in ways Venus does not. 

My opinion of human survival is that we first need to decide if humans belong to the Earth or if the Earth belongs to humans. I don't think there will be a successful outcome if we decide the Earth belongs to humans.

I found 3 fascinating books that deals with this issue of human roles on Earth. These books do not offer solutions. 

Best read in this order but not necessary really. Ishmael, My Ishmael and The Story of B. By Daniel Quinn.
